name: Asymptotics.IsBigO.integrableAtFilter
initialProofState:

âŠ¢ MeasureTheory.IntegrableAtFilter f l Î¼
decl:
/-- If `f = O[l] g` on measurably generated `l`, `f` is strongly measurable at `l`,
and `g` is integrable at `l`, then `f` is integrable at `l`. -/
theorem IsBigO.integrableAtFilter [IsMeasurablyGenerated l]
    (hf : f =O[l] g) (hfm : StronglyMeasurableAtFilter f l Î¼) (hg : IntegrableAtFilter g l Î¼) :
    IntegrableAtFilter f l Î¼ := by
  obtain âŸ¨C, hCâŸ© := hf.bound
  obtain âŸ¨s, hsl, hsm, hfg, hf, hgâŸ© :=
    (hC.smallSets.and <| hfm.eventually.and hg.eventually).exists_measurable_mem_of_smallSets
  refine âŸ¨s, hsl, (hg.norm.const_mul C).mono hf ?_âŸ©
  refine (ae_restrict_mem hsm).mono fun x hx â†¦ ?_
  exact (hfg x hx).trans (le_abs_self _)

theorem IsBigO.integrable (hfm : AEStronglyMeasurable f Î¼)

decl:
/-- Let `f : X x Y â†’ Z`. If as `y` tends to `l`, `f(x, y) = O(g(y))` uniformly on `s : Set X`
of finite measure, then f is eventually (as `y` tends to `l`) integrable along `s`. -/
theorem IsBigO.eventually_integrableOn [Norm F]
    (hf : f =O[ğ“Ÿ s Ã—Ë¢ l] (g âˆ˜ Prod.snd))
    (hfm : âˆ€á¶  x in l, AEStronglyMeasurable (fun i â†¦ f (i, x)) (Î¼.restrict s))
    (hs : MeasurableSet s) (hÎ¼ : Î¼ s < âŠ¤) :
    âˆ€á¶  x in l, IntegrableOn (fun i â†¦ f (i, x)) s Î¼ := by
  obtain âŸ¨C, hCâŸ© := hf.bound
  obtain âŸ¨t, htl, htâŸ© := hC.exists_mem
  obtain âŸ¨u, hu, v, hv, huvâŸ© := Filter.mem_prod_iff.mp htl
  obtain âŸ¨w, hwl, hwâŸ© := hfm.exists_mem
  refine eventually_iff_exists_mem.mpr âŸ¨w âˆ© v, inter_mem hwl hv, fun x hx â†¦ ?_âŸ©
  haveI : IsFiniteMeasure (Î¼.restrict s) := âŸ¨Measure.restrict_apply_univ s â–¸ hÎ¼âŸ©
  refine Integrable.mono' (integrable_const (C * â€–g xâ€–)) (hw x hx.1) ?_
  filter_upwards [MeasureTheory.self_mem_ae_restrict hs]
  intro y hy
  exact ht (y, x) <| huv âŸ¨hu hy, hx.2âŸ©

decl:
/-- Let `f : X x Y â†’ Z`. If as `y` tends to `l`, `f(x, y) = O(g(y))` uniformly on `s : Set X`
of finite measure, then the integral of `f` along `s` is `O(g(y))`. -/
theorem IsBigO.set_integral_isBigO
    (hf : f =O[ğ“Ÿ s Ã—Ë¢ l] (g âˆ˜ Prod.snd)) (hs : MeasurableSet s) (hÎ¼ : Î¼ s < âŠ¤)  :
    (fun x â†¦ âˆ« i in s, f (i, x) âˆ‚Î¼) =O[l] g := by
  obtain âŸ¨C, hCâŸ© := hf.bound
  obtain âŸ¨t, htl, htâŸ© := hC.exists_mem
  obtain âŸ¨u, hu, v, hv, huvâŸ© := Filter.mem_prod_iff.mp htl
  refine isBigO_iff.mpr âŸ¨C * (Î¼ s).toReal, eventually_iff_exists_mem.mpr âŸ¨v, hv, fun x hx â†¦ ?_âŸ©âŸ©
  rw [mul_assoc, â† smul_eq_mul (a' := â€–g xâ€–), â† MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict_apply_univ,
    â† integral_const, mul_comm, â† smul_eq_mul, â† integral_smul_const]
  haveI : IsFiniteMeasure (Î¼.restrict s) := âŸ¨by rw [Measure.restrict_apply_univ s]; exact hÎ¼âŸ©
  refine (norm_integral_le_integral_norm _).trans <|
    integral_mono_of_nonneg (univ_mem' fun _ â†¦ norm_nonneg _) (integrable_const _) ?_
  filter_upwards [MeasureTheory.self_mem_ae_restrict hs]
  intro y hy
  rw [smul_eq_mul, mul_comm]
  exact ht (y, x) <| huv âŸ¨hu hy, hxâŸ©

/-- If `f` is locally integrable, `â€–f(-x)â€– = â€–f(x)â€–`, and `f =O[atTop] g`, for some

theorem LocallyIntegrable.integrable_of_isBigO_atTop_of_norm_isNegInvariant

    (hf : LocallyIntegrable f Î¼) (hsymm : norm âˆ˜ f =áµ[Î¼] norm âˆ˜ f âˆ˜ Neg.neg) (ho : f =O[atTop] g)
    (hg : IntegrableAtFilter g atTop Î¼) : Integrable f Î¼ := by
